Given the current state with the avatar at position (7, 2), and the last position being the same, it indicates that the last action did not result in a movement. This could imply that a directional action was attempted but the avatar rotated instead.

Analyzing the surrounding layout reveals that:
- To the left (7, 1) is empty (.), 
- To the right (7, 3) is also empty (.),
- Up (6, 2) has a boulder (@),
- Down (8, 2) is empty (.).

Since the previous action did not move the avatar, I will attempt to move right to (7, 3) as the first valid action and explore the area further from there.

``` Action:2 ```
This action moves the avatar to the right into an empty space which allows for further exploration.

Now that the avatar is at position (7, 3), it has successfully moved to the right from the last position (7, 2). This action was beneficial, as it opened up more options for exploration. 

In this new state:
- To the left (7, 2) has the avatar's previous position,
- To the right (7, 4) has a wall (w),
- Up (6, 3) is empty (.),
- Down (8, 3) is empty (.).

Since the only advantageous movements are up (6, 3) or down (8, 3), I will choose to move down to (8, 3). This way, I can continue exploring the lower row and look for further paths or interaction opportunities.

``` Action:3 ```
This action will allow the avatar to move down, providing access to new surroundings.
